title: Laser
description: This element describes a Light Source, which emits coherent radiation at high spectral concentrations of radiance and minimal solid angles. This includes proper Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation (LASER) sources that emit light through a process of optical amplification based on the stimulated emission of electromagnetic radiation. It also includes Optical Parametric Oscillator (OPO) sources that use a kind of LASER resonator but based on optical gain from parametric amplification in a nonlinear crystal rather than from stimulated emission.

subCategoriesOrder.ManufacturerSpec: This describes the Manufacturer specifications for this component (i.e., Manufacturer Name, Model designation and Catalog Number).
subCategoriesOrder.LightSource: This element describes one or more Light Source(s) available for this Instrument. An Instrument may have several Light Sources of different types (Laser, Light Emitting Diode, Filament, Arc etc.). A typical fluorescence Microscope has two Light Sources, one for Transmitted light and one for Fluorescence light.
subCategoriesOrder.Laser: This element describes a Light Source, which emits coherent radiation at high spectral concentrations of radiance and minimal solid angles. This includes proper Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation (LASER) sources that emit light through a process of optical amplification based on the stimulated emission of electromagnetic radiation. It also includes Optical Parametric Oscillator (OPO) sources that use a kind of LASER resonator but based on optical gain from parametric amplification in a nonlinear crystal rather than from stimulated emission.
subCategoriesOrder.IlluminationWavelengthRange: This element records a range of Wavelengths at which this Light Source emits according to the Manufacturer. Multiple of this element may be used.
subCategoriesOrder.Pump: In case the primary Laser is Pumped this element describe a secondary Laser positioned upstream of the primary Laser and used to pump it.

Type.description: This field captures the general category of this Laser. Please note that Optical Parametric Oscillators (OPO) are listed here even though they are technically not a LASER. They produce optical gain not through stimulated emission but via parametric amplification in a non-linear crystal.

Tuneable.description: This field records whether (True) or not (False) this Laser is Tunable to different Wavelengths

ModulationMechanism.description: This field captures the Modulation Mechanism used for this Laser.

Pulse.description: Whether this Laser emits light in the form of optical Pulses (i.e., light flashes; True) or as a Continuous Wave (CW; False).

LaserClass.description: This describes the safety Class this Laser belongs to. Laser Classes are defined based on their potential for causing injury to humans’ eyes and skin.

LaserMedium.description: This field captures the material out of which this Laser is constructed.

IsPumped.description: Whether (True) or not (False) this is a pumped Laser.

IsPump.description: Whether (True) or not (False) this laser serves as a Pump for a downstream laser.

Position.description: This field captures the position of this Laser on a Multi Laser Engine.

RepetitionRate.description: In the case this is a pulsed Laser (Pulse is True), this field (also known as Pulse Frequency) describes the frequency of laser pulses. The default unit is Hz.

PulseDuration.description: In the case this is a pulsed Laser (Pulse is True), this field describes the duration of each Laser pulse.

FrequencyMultiplication.description: This field captures the optical frequency multiplication factor that may be specified for this Laser.

UsedAcoustoOpticalDevice.description: This field records whether (True) or not (False) an AcoustoOptical Device was utilized during this Calibration Procedure.

Name.description: A User-defined Name for this component.

ID.description: A Unique Identifier for this component.

PurchaseDate.description: This field records the Date in which this Light Source was purchased.

IlluminationPowerReportingStatistic.description: This field reports the statistic used by the Manufacturer to report the nominal Illumination Power output emitted by this Light Source at Peak Wavelength.

IlluminationPowerReportingPosition.description: This field records the Position where the reported Illumination Intensity value was obtained as reported by the Manufacturer.

Manufacturer.description: This field refers to the company, research group or individual who built or manufactured this hardware component.

Model.description: This field refers to the Model name or any other designation the Manufacturer uses for this component.

CatalogNumber.description: This field records the Catalog, Part or Serial Number used by the Manufacturer to uniquely identify this component.

LotNumber.description: The Lot Number used by the Manufacturer to refer to a specific production batch or lot for this component.

SpecsFile.title: SpecsFile
SpecsFile.description: This element refers to a PDF file that contains the specifications for this hardware component as provided by the Manufacturer.

Description.title: Description
Description.description: This is an empty element that refers to an Annotation (typically a Comment Annotation that consists of a simple multi-line comment) describing this component.

IlluminationWavelengthRange.description: This element records a range of Wavelengths at which this Light Source emits, according to the Manufacturer. Multiple of this element may be used.

IlluminationPower.description: This field records the nominal Illumination Power (also known as Power Output or Illumination Intensity) emitted at Peak Wavelength by this Light Source, as advertised by the Manufacturer.

PeakWavelength.description: This field records the nominal Wavelength associated with the peak response rate of this device.

CutOn.description: CutOn is the Wavelength below which the response rate is below 50%. In case a CutOn Wavelength is not available, such as in the case of a ShortPass or Notch configuration, please enter 000.

CutOff.description: CutOff is the Wavelength above which the response rate is below 50%. In case a CutOff Wavelength is not available, such as in the case of a LongPass configuration, please enter 000.

Pump.description: In case the primary Laser is Pumped, this element describe a secondary Laser, positioned upstream of the primary Laser and used to pump it.

Tier.description: The tier level of this component.
